title: onepromptSite Home Page
prompt:
Create a homepage for a project called
  "OnePromptSites" â€” a visually striking, modern directory that
  showcases websites created from a single AI prompt.
    
    The homepage should include:
    
    â€“ Title: â€œOnePromptSitesâ€
    â€“ Below the title, show a subheading that cycles slowly every few seconds
  between the following SEO-visible phrases with a soft fade transition:
    â€¢ One prompt, one site â€“ infinite possibilities.
    â€¢ Microstartups, macro inspiration â€“ all built with a single prompt.
    â€¢ One idea. One prompt. Zero code. Witness the magic.
    â€¢ From prompt to product: see oneâ€‘prompt wonders in action.
    â€¢ AI alchemy â€“ turning a oneâ€‘line prompt into a live website.
    â€“ Below the subheading, include this static intro paragraph:
    "OnePromptSites is a curated archive of websites created from a single
  AI prompt. Each entry reveals the exact prompt used, the tools involved, and
  honest insights into what worked (and what didnâ€™t). It's a behind-the-scenes
  look at how far one good prompt can go."
    â€“ Under the intro paragraph, in smaller italicized text:
    "Built from one core AI prompt (with only minor edits for
  polish)"
    â€“ Beneath that, add a simple horizontal visual flow: OnePrompt â†’ Site â†’
  Launch
    
    Use the following JSON as the data an example of format to provide the code
  in:
  [https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dgriff86/oneprompt-json-host/refs/heads/main/1prompt.json](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dgriff86/oneprompt-json-host/refs/heads/main/new1prompt.json)
    
    For each site entry:
    â€“ Show a screenshot using `previewImage` if present
    â€“ If missing, render a fallback card with:
    â€¢ A clean, readable background
    â€¢ Centered title
    â€¢ Label: â€œPreview Not Availableâ€
    â€“ Below the preview:
    â€¢ Title (clickable, opens `url` in new tab)
    â€¢ Date (from `createdAt`) in format like "May 12, 2025"
    â€¢ A toggle dropdown: "View Prompt" â†’ expands to show the full
  `prompt` in a <pre> block, styled with high contrast and includes a
  â€œCopy Promptâ€ button positioned at the top of the expanded area
    â€¢ Optional toggle: "Build Notes" â†’ show if any of the following
  are present: `tool`, `whatWorked`, `whatDidntWork`, `nextSteps`
    â€“ If `notes` exist, display them subtly
    â€“ If `projurl` exists, display a small link or button labeled â€œVisit Live
  Siteâ€ (opens in new tab)
    
    Below the card list:
    â€“ Paginate results (10 per page), sorted newest to oldest
    â€“ Navigation control at the bottom: â€œPrevious / Nextâ€
    
    Sponsor Block:
    â€“ If a sponsor image URL exists in the project code, show it in a styled banner
    â€“ Else show default:
    â€¢ Heading: "Sponsor this site"
    â€¢ Subtext: "Get featured here â€” email
  [sponsor@onepromptsites.com](mailto:sponsor@onepromptsites.com)"
    
    SEO & Metadata:
    â€“ Title: OnePromptSites
    â€“ Meta description: A growing archive of websites built with one prompt
  alone.
    â€“ Use default social image if none provided
    
    In public folder:
    â€“ Create a blank file named `sitemap.xml`, leave empty for manual
  updates
    
    Favicon:
    â€“ Include standard <link rel="icon"> markup in <head>
  pointing to a favicon relevant to the site, using the provided image. Save
  this as `favicon.ico` in the public root folder. This favicon must be
  manually added to the directory.
    
    Footer:
    â€“ Centered: â€œBuilt with AI Â· One prompt at a timeâ€
notes:
Showcase of prompt generating the home page. Some
  text edited in code directly after the prompt.
whatWorked:
Simple and straightforward, Iâ€™ve been refining my
  personal GPT to learn what works best.
whatDidntWork:
1 code fix automatically cycled. I found that
  trying to force a specific theme through detailed wording often restricted
  the AI too much. Instead, I started attaching a reference image of the style
  I wanted, that shift made a huge difference in how well the results matched
  my vision.
nextSteps:
Use this as the base for fivepromptsites.com. Might
  take this off oneprompt to make it easier to manage in the future.

title: GymBro Home Page
prompt:
Create a fully functional, mobile-first single-gym website
  named "onepromptGymBro" that includes:
    
    - A public-facing user view
    - A gym owner/admin dashboard
    - Toggle-based layout switching with proper state management
    
    Design should reflect brands like F45 or CrossFit â€” clean, bold, minimal,
  and optimized for mobile.
    
    ---
    
    Header & Toggle Controls (Responsive & Functional)
    
    - Fixed top nav bar with onepromptGymBro logo
    - View toggle with 2 options:
    Â  - â€œUser Viewâ€
    Â  - â€œAdmin Viewâ€
    - On mobile:
    Â  - Use a dropdown or tab switcher
  for compact toggle
    Â  - Ensure tap targets are
  touch-friendly
    - Clicking a toggle:
    Â  - Updates a `viewMode` value in
  localStorage (e.g., `user`, `admin`)
    Â  - Re-renders the page content based
  on the selected mode
    - On page load:
    Â  - Check localStorage for last used
  `viewMode`
    Â  - Default to "User View"
  if none found
    - Each view must conditionally render its section â€” only one active view at
  a time
    
    ---
    
    User View (Public Site)
    
    - Hero section with gym branding and CTA
    - Enquiry form (name, email, phone, message)
    Â  - Stores to localStorage and shows
  confirmation
    - Daily Workout (pulls latest "Published" workout)
    - Class Schedule (pre-filled or synced from Admin)
    - Mobile-friendly footer
    
    ---
    
    Admin View (Gym Owner Dashboard)
    
    - Leads Panel
    Â  - Table of enquiries with notes +
  follow-up email
    Â  - â€œConvert to Memberâ€ opens modal
  with sign-up
    - Members Panel
    Â  - List of members with editable
  info
    Â  - Send Welcome/Exit emails
    - Workout Manager
    Â  - Add/edit/delete workouts, mark
  one as â€œPublishedâ€
    - Class Scheduler
    Â  - Weekly grid of gym classes with
  fields
    
    ---
    
    Data Handling
    
    - All data in localStorage: enquiries, members, workouts, schedules
    - View toggle must persist and reflect changes live
    
    ---
    
    Styling
    
    - Responsive layout, sticky headers, collapsible panels on mobile
    - Tabs, cards, and modals for clean UX
    
    ---
    
    User Stories
    
    1. As a visitor, I want to submit a contact form.
    2. As a visitor, I want to view the daily workout.
    3. As a visitor, I want to browse the class schedule.
    4â€“11. As a gym owner, I want to manage leads, members, workouts, and
  schedules with proper feedback and flow.
    
    ---
    
    Build Guidelines
    
    - No backend, only localStorage
    - View toggle must:
    Â  - Set `viewMode` in
  localStorage
    Â  - Load correct view on
  refresh
    Â  - Ensure only active view content
  is rendered
notes:
Showcase of prompt generating the home page. Some
  text edited in code directly after the prompt.
whatWorked:
This is my first site on bolt. Not sure I love it but will
  continue testing
whatDidntWork:
You can't force to much through AI. I really wanted a member
  login section as well member engagement functions but the prompt just got too
  sophisticated and AI couldn't keep up.
nextSteps: Member Portal + Health Tracking + Booking + Billing

title: EXCEL to JSON Home page
prompt:
Create a mobile-first web app that lets users paste Excel or
  Google Sheets data â€” including complex, multiline cells â€” directly into an
  interactive HTML table. This table should be editable, convertible to JSON,
  and support clean output formatting.
    
    ---
    
    CORE GOALÂ  
    Enable a seamless paste-from-Excel experience that accurately renders
  pasted tables (including line breaks within cells) and allows real-time
  editing, conversion, and download as JSON.
    
    ---
    
    PASTE & TABLE INPUTÂ  
    - Use a large, styled `<div contenteditable="true">` as the
  main paste zone.
    - On paste:
    Â  - Intercept clipboard HTML using
  `e.clipboardData.getData("text/html")`
    Â  - Extract the `<table>`
  element from the pasted content
    Â  - If no table is found, display a
  gentle error message
    - Render the extracted table visually, maintaining:
    Â  - Row/column structure
    Â  - Line breaks, paragraph spacing
  inside cells
    Â  - Merged cells as separate values
  (optional: flatten colspan/rowspan)
    Â  - Multiple rows of header data, if
  present
    
    ---
    
    TABLE RENDERINGÂ  
    - Display the table inside a styled, scrollable card with `rounded-2xl`,
  `shadow`, and `p-4`
    - Each cell should be editable using `contenteditable`
    - Maintain a JSON object behind the scenes that stays in sync with
  edits
    
    ---
    
    CONVERSION & OUTPUTÂ  
    - Provide the following output tools:
    Â  - â€œConvert to JSONâ€ button â†’
  creates structured array with headers as keys
    Â  - â€œCopy JSONâ€ button â†’ copies final
  output
    Â  - â€œDownload JSONâ€ button â†’
  downloads file
    Â  - Optional: "Copy as CSV"
  or "Download as .csv"
    - Preserve special characters, embedded line breaks, and whitespace in
  output
    - Output JSON should be pretty-printed, with a toggle for minified
  output
    
    ---
    
    POWER FEATURESÂ  
    - â€œClear Tableâ€ button â†’ resets the entire paste/render area
    - Find & Replace functionality:
    Â  - Search within entire table or
  specific column
    Â  - Replace globally or
  per-match
    - Toggle for schema preview (key:type)
    - Toggle between raw JSON view and table view
    - Optional: Detect headers if missing and prompt user to define them
    
    ---
    
    VISUAL DESIGNÂ  
    - Tailwind-style UI:
    Â  - Paste area: `border-dashed`,
  `p-4`, `text-gray-600`
    Â  - Table: clean white background,
  subtle border, zebra striping
    Â  - Cells: `hover:bg-gray-100`,
  editable cursor
    - Responsive: works on mobile and desktop
    - Smooth transitions when data is pasted, cleared, or toggled
    - Footer: â€œBuilt with love Â· One prompt at a timeâ€ (centered, sticky on
  mobile)
    
    ---
    
    ADVANCED OPTIONS (optional toggle drawer)Â 
  
    - Merge rows with shared keys
    - Validate field types
    - Export multiple tables (if detected) as separate JSON objects
    - Detect and split multiple tables if pasted in one go
    
    ---
    
    SEO & BACKENDÂ  
    - Include blank `sitemap.xml` in `public/`
    - Title: â€œPaste Excel to Table to JSONâ€
    - Description: â€œPaste Excel tables into editable HTML and export to clean
  JSON instantly.â€
    - Meta viewport + favicon
    
    ---
    
    This project should feel magical: paste â†’ render â†’ edit â†’ export. No
  uploads. No config. Just flow.
notes:
The site was built to make my life easier. There are other
  converters but wanted easy copy and paste from excel tables.
whatWorked:
Great simple clean site. Something I'll be using for my
  projects going forward.
whatDidntWork:
Lovable didn't build in a new favicon so stuck with the defaultâ€¦ Site should
  have been named onepromptEXCELtoJSON. Code was manually edited. Google AdSense slot request was
  ignored by AI, will need to add it manually later if this concept works.
nextSteps:
I would like support for multiple tables in one JSON to simulate multi-table
  database structure. If successful, plans to remix into fivepromptSites concept.

title: CafeConcept Home page
prompt:
Build a fully functional, mobile-first cafÃ© website called
  CafÃ© Concept using this JSON as the complete data source:
    
    JSON URL:Â  
    https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dgriff86/oneprompt-json-host/refs/heads/main/cafecocept.json
    
    ---
    
    Site Structure and Views
    
    1. Landing Page (Welcome View)Â 
  
    - A warm hero section with the cafÃ© name, a short welcome blurb, and a soft
  background imageÂ  
    - A clear call-to-action button labeled "Browse Our Menu" that
  scrolls or transitions to the menu viewÂ 
  
    - Optional elements include opening hours, location, or daily special
    
    2. Menu View (Customer Order Mode)Â 
  
    - Load categories sorted by their sort_order fieldÂ  
    - Display menu_items grouped under each categoryÂ  
    - Use a compact, mobile-first grid layout with two tiles per row on mobile
  and three or more on larger screensÂ 
  
    - Each menu tile should show the name, description, base price, and
  availability statusÂ  
    - Tapping a menu item opens a modal for selecting available add-ons,
  sourced from addon_groupsÂ  
    - Enforce rules for required selections and multiple selections where
  applicableÂ  
    - Add-on pricing should update the item total dynamicallyÂ  
    - A floating cart icon or sticky footer should summarize selected
  itemsÂ  
    - When the "Place Order" button is clicked:
    Â  - Route items to the correct prep
  queue based on their prep_area
    Â  - Clear the cart completely
    Â  - Display a temporary confirmation
  message such as "Order Submitted" for at least three seconds
    
    3. Prep Queues (Barista and Kitchen Split)Â 
  
    - Every menu item includes a prep_area field that designates it as either
  barista or kitchenÂ  
    - Orders should be automatically split into two separate queues based on
  prep_areaÂ  
    - Each queue operates independently and tracks items with statuses: queued,
  in_progress, and doneÂ  
    - Changing the status of an item in one queue should not affect items in
  the otherÂ  
    - Only the last three completed items should be displayed in each
  queueÂ  
    - Older completed items should be auto-archivedÂ  
    - Optionally include a manual "Clear Completed" button
    
    4. Admin Panel (Local Menu Editor)Â 
  
    - A local-only admin interface using localStorage to persist changesÂ  
    - Allow full CRUD (create, read, update, delete) functionality for:
    Â  - menu_items
    Â  - categories
    Â  - addons
    Â  - addon_groupsÂ  
    - Editable fields should include: name, base price, category, prep_area,
  and availabilityÂ  
    - Admins should be able to assign or remove addon groups from menu
  itemsÂ  
    - Include a button labeled "Download JSON" to export the current
  data structure as a file
    
    5. Front-of-House Table Entry ViewÂ 
  
    - A staff-facing interface to enter and manage table ordersÂ  
    - Allow selection or entry of a table numberÂ  
    - Let staff build an order using the full menu UI, including addon
  selectionÂ  
    - Optionally support item-specific notes such as "no sugar" or
  "allergy: dairy"Â  
    - Once submitted, items should route automatically to their respective prep
  queuesÂ  
    - Display a list of active orders by table and optionally allow marking
  them as paid or closed
    
    ---
    
    Navigation and View Switching
    
    - Include a persistent navigation bar or tab menu that allows switching
  between these four views:
    Â  1. Menu View (Customer)
    Â  2. Prep Queues (Barista and
  Kitchen)
    Â  3. Admin Panel (Local
  Editing)
    Â  4. FOH Table Entry (Staff
  Use)
    
    ---
    
    Styling and UX
    
    - Design should be mobile-first with responsive layouts for all
  screensÂ  
    - Layout and typography should take inspiration from high-end Australian
  cafÃ©s such as Industry Beans or Proud MaryÂ 
  
    - Prioritize compact menu cards, clean white space, and clear visual
  hierarchyÂ  
    - Use smooth transitions, swipe-friendly interactions, and sticky action
  buttons for better mobile usabilityÂ 
  
    - Use a neutral, modern color palette with no visual clutterÂ  
    - Add a footer with the message: "Built with love Â· One prompt at a
  time"
    
    ---
    
    Fixes and Logic Notes
    
    - After submitting an order, always clear the cart by resetting its
  stateÂ  
    - Display a clear "Order Submitted" confirmation message that
  remains visible for at least three secondsÂ 
  
    - Ensure barista and kitchen queues are handled independently and never
  sync their states automaticallyÂ  
    - Limit displayed completed orders in each queue to the three most recent
  items
    
    ---
    
    General Notes
    
    - All menu and structure data should be loaded directly from the external
  JSON fileÂ  
    - Do not hardcode any menu contentÂ 
  
    - All admin edits should persist locally using localStorageÂ  
    - No backend services or login functionality are requiredÂ  
    - The website should continue working offline after the initial load
notes:
I'm so happy with how this turned out! Tested out serving
  dummy database tables through a JSON file and the functionality is awesome!
whatWorked:
Functionality and menu admin is way better than expected. Can
  edit and manage everything from pricing to add-ons. Separate kitchen and
  barista queues for workflow works well.
whatDidntWork:
8 code fix cycles. Minor bug that you canâ€™t return
  to landing page once in the menu. Customer initiated orders donâ€™t provide the
  option to enter name or table numbers. Favicon updated in a single separate
  prompt. Lovables favicon anoys me.
nextSteps:
Booking system > Billing and tax > Discounting and
  Specials

title: I present Promptosauris
prompt:
Create a polished, professional web app called â€œPromptosaurisâ€
  â€” a focused workspace for browsing, customizing, and managing AI
  prompts.
    
    Use the following JSON as the data source:
    https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dgriff86/oneprompt-json-host/main/promptosauris.json
    
    Each prompt includes:
    - category (string)
    - promptName (string)
    - prompt (string, may include [TOPIC])
    
    ---
    
    Purpose:
    Designed for professionals who regularly use AI tools in their workflows.
  Users can quickly explore categorized prompts, personalize them with a topic,
  and copy or pin frequently used ones for reuse.
    
    ---
    
    Layout Overview:
    
    1. **Header**
    - App name: â€œPromptosaurisâ€
    - Subtext: â€œA smarter way to manage promptsâ€
    - Top-right theme toggle (light/dark)
    - Favicon: clean dinosaur icon or stylized â€œPâ€
    
    2. **Global Topic Field**
    - Input labeled: â€œSet your topic to personalize promptsâ€
    - Placeholder: â€œe.g. financial planningâ€
    - Automatically replaces `[TOPIC]` wherever used
    - Store in localStorage
    
    3. **Pinned Prompts**
    - Display fixed above prompt list if any prompts are pinned
    - Show compact tags or rows with:
    Â  - Prompt name
    Â  - Quick copy and remove
  buttons
    - Include "Copy All" to copy full list at once
    
    4. **Navigation & View Toggle**
    - Sidebar or sticky top nav on desktop, dropdown on mobile
    - Filter by category or toggle:
    Â  - â€œAll Promptsâ€
    Â  - â€œPinned Promptsâ€
    - Optional search bar with live filter (name, category, content)
    
    5. **Prompt Display**
    - Clean, compact prompt rows
    - Each includes:
    Â  - Prompt name
    Â  - Buttons: View, Copy, Pin
    - Expanded view shows full prompt (with `[TOPIC]` applied)
    - Keep spacing tight and button grouping consistent
    
    6. **Personalized Prompts**
    - If `[TOPIC]` is set:
    Â  - Show separate section: â€œPrompts
  for: [TOPIC]â€
    Â  - Filtered list of prompts
  containing `[TOPIC]`
    Â  - Appears above other
  categories
    
    7. **Smart Suggestions (Optional)**
    - Below each prompt or section, show â€œYou might also likeâ€¦â€ based on
  category or usage
    - Simple links or chips â€” no clutter
    
    8. **Responsive Ad Units (Optional)**
    - Support Google AdSense (optional key-based load)
    - Show ads only if a valid key is supplied
    - Recommended positions:
    Â  - After topic input
    Â  - Above footer
    - Ads should not appear between prompt rows
    
    ---
    
    Styling:
    
    **Overall Aesthetic:**
    - Professional, minimal, and neutral
    - Prioritize clarity, whitespace, and hierarchy
    - No visual clutter or excessive color
    
    **Light Mode (default):**
    - Background: #FAFAFA
    - Font: modern sans-serif (e.g. Inter, Helvetica, Source Sans)
    - Cards: subtle borders, light shadows
    
    **Dark Mode:**
    - Background: #121212
    - Text: #E0E0E0
    - Buttons and accents: muted blues or teals
    
    ---
    
    ğŸ’¾ Logic & Functionality:
    - All data is static, loaded from JSON
    - No backend or login required
    - Use localStorage for:
    Â  - Theme preference
    Â  - Pinned prompts
    Â  - Topic input
    
    - Ensure:
    Â  - Mobile responsiveness
    Â  - Keyboard accessibility
    Â  - Fast search + no reloads on
  interaction
    
    ---
    
    Â Footer:
    Include subtle footer:Â  
    â€œPromptosauris Â· Built with AI Â· One prompt at a timeâ€
    
    ---
    
    Â Developer Notes:
    - Detect and replace `[TOPIC]` dynamically across preview, copy, and
  pin
    - Never mutate or overwrite original JSON
    - Ensure layout remains performant for >100 prompts
    - Keep prompt rows and action buttons clean, consistent, and tightly
  grouped
notes:
I found it hard to get something I liked! Actually pretty hard
  designing something that's simplistic and easy enough to use. I'm 80% happy
  with this.
whatWorked:
Functionality off the bat was good with some minor clean ups
  required like removing categories from tiles.
whatDidntWork:
It was difficult to get a UX that I was somewhat happy with
  it.
nextSteps:
Clean up the content. Think I can make the prompt library way
  better with more curated prompts.
